subtitle: Alcohol is harmful to you and your baby
description: Alcohol is harmful to you and your baby
title: Can I drink alcohol?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

It is better not to drink alcohol while you are pregnant, and also while you are breastfeeding. This will keep your baby safe and healthy. 

A small amount of alcohol is usually safe, and if you had a small amount of alcohol before you knew you were pregnant, do not worry.  But it is best not to drink any alcohol while you are pregnant. 

Here’s why. Alcohol is a harmful substance. When you drink alcohol, it rapidly reaches your baby via your bloodstream. Heavy drinking can cause pregnancy loss and premature birth. Too much alcohol can even increase the risk of your baby being stillborn. 

If you drink too much alcohol during pregnancy, it can permanently damage your developing baby's cells. This could affect how your baby's face, organs and brain grow. 

Remember that traditional medicines may contain alcohol. So they are not good for you at all! They are bad for you and your baby, so do not use them.
